# state

**Instance Property**

The state of the control, specified as a bit mask value.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var state: UIControl.State { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is a bitmask of the constants in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIControl/State-swift.struct] type. A control can be in more than one state at a time. For example, it can be focused and highlighted at the same time. You can also get the values for individual states using the properties of this class.

## Managing state

- **UIControl.State**: Constants describing the state of a control.
- **isEnabled**: A Boolean value indicating whether the control is in the enabled state.
- **isSelected**: A Boolean value indicating whether the control is in the selected state.
- **isHighlighted**: A Boolean value indicating whether the control draws a highlight.
